20110118140913.000|20110118140916.000|TR0|

20110118140918.000|20110118140921.000|TR0|China's economy good for or bad for the 
20110118140921.000|20110118140924.000|TR0|U.S.?  I think a lot of the rhetoric you 
20110118140924.000|20110118140926.000|TR0|hear out there is that this only gets bad. 
20110118140926.000|20110118140929.000|TR0| I want to give you the bad and the good. 
20110118140929.000|20110118140931.000|TR0|Let's go over to the wall --
20110118140931.000|20110118140934.000|TR0|
20110118140934.000|20110118140937.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  OK.
20110118140937.000|20110118140939.000|TR0|
20110118140939.000|20110118140942.000|TR0|VELSHI:  -- and let me, first, show you 
20110118140942.000|20110118140944.000|TR0|what a lot of people will tell you is the 
20110118140944.000|20110118140947.000|TR0|bad.  And by the way, it all depends on 
20110118140947.000|20110118140950.000|TR0|where you stand. There are a lot of 
20110118140950.000|20110118140952.000|TR0|companies that make money out of this and 
20110118140952.000|20110118140955.000|TR0|you might be invested in them through your 
20110118140955.000|20110118140957.000|TR0|401(k).
20110118140957.000|20110118141000.000|TR0|
20110118141000.000|20110118141003.000|TR0|The bottom line is the Yuan, the Chinese 
20110118141003.000|20110118141005.000|TR0|currency, is pegged to the U.S. dollars.  
20110118141005.000|20110118141008.000|TR0|It doesn't float like other currencies.  A 
20110118141008.000|20110118141010.000|TR0|lot of people say that it is undervalued 
20110118141010.000|20110118141013.000|TR0|by 10 percent to 40 percent.
20110118141013.000|20110118141016.000|TR0|
20110118141016.000|20110118141018.000|TR0|What does that mean?  Well, it means that 
20110118141018.000|20110118141021.000|TR0|things that are made in China end up being 
20110118141021.000|20110118141023.000|TR0|cheaper than equivalent U.S. goods because 
20110118141023.000|20110118141026.000|TR0|you pay for them in this Yuan.  You use 
20110118141026.000|20110118141029.000|TR0|your dollars to buy this Yuan, and it ends 
20110118141029.000|20110118141031.000|TR0|up being cheaper.  So, that becomes 
20110118141031.000|20110118141034.000|TR0|uncompetitive for U.S. industries.
20110118141034.000|20110118141036.000|TR0|
20110118141036.000|20110118141039.000|TR0|Now, here's another issue: hard work for 
20110118141039.000|20110118141042.000|TR0|little pay.  Chinese workers end up 
20110118141042.000|20110118141044.000|TR0|earning -- manufacturing workers end 
20110118141044.000|20110118141047.000|TR0|earning the equivalent of about $1 a day.  
20110118141047.000|20110118141049.000|TR0|Now, the fact is that that is changing.  
20110118141049.000|20110118141052.000|TR0|The work force in China is changing.  I'll 
20110118141052.000|20110118141055.000|TR0|tell you about that in a second.
20110118141055.000|20110118141057.000|TR0|
20110118141057.000|20110118141100.000|TR0|But in China, like in America, there is a 
20110118141100.000|20110118141103.000|TR0|buy China movement.  So, the idea is that 
20110118141103.000|20110118141105.000|TR0|if you manufacture, produce and sell 
20110118141105.000|20110118141108.000|TR0|things in China, you get certain tax 
20110118141108.000|20110118141110.000|TR0|incentives and that is making it 
20110118141110.000|20110118141113.000|TR0|unfavorable for American made goods to be 
20110118141113.000|20110118141116.000|TR0|sold in China, even though there is a 
20110118141116.000|20110118141118.000|TR0|growing consumer population there.
20110118141118.000|20110118141121.000|TR0|
20110118141121.000|20110118141123.000|TR0|And what you mentioned a moment ago, Kyra, 
20110118141123.000|20110118141126.000|TR0|China is the banker of the world.  China 
20110118141126.000|20110118141129.000|TR0|has - holds $938,000 in U.S. debt but they 
20110118141129.000|20110118141131.000|TR0|actually lent more to developing countries

20110118141142.000|20110118141144.000|TR0|That's the bad for the U.S. economy.

20110118143334.000|20110118143336.000|TR0|You know, you cannot define me or try to

20110118143433.000|20110118143436.000|TR0|

20110118143720.000|20110118143723.000|TR0|Christine Romans in New York to tell us

20110118143725.000|20110118143728.000|TR0|
20110118143728.000|20110118143730.000|TR0|First of all, let's have a little FAFSA 
20110118143730.000|20110118143733.000|TR0|101.  I don't think everybody knows what 
20110118143733.000|20110118143736.000|TR0|that is.
20110118143736.000|20110118143738.000|TR0|
20110118143738.000|20110118143741.000|TR0|CHRISTINE ROMANS, CNN BUSINESS 
20110118143741.000|20110118143743.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  If you're the parent or a 
20110118143743.000|20110118143746.000|TR0|grandparent of a college senior, -- high 
20110118143746.000|20110118143749.000|TR0|school senior, rather -- you're learning 
20110118143749.000|20110118143751.000|TR0|what that is.  FAFSA is the Free 
20110118143751.000|20110118143754.000|TR0|Application for Federal Student Aid -- 
20110118143754.000|20110118143756.000|TR0|FAFSA.  It's a government form that you 
20110118143756.000|20110118143759.000|TR0|need to file that shows what the 
20110118143759.000|20110118143802.000|TR0|government determines is your share, what 
20110118143802.000|20110118143804.000|TR0|you can afford to pay for college.  And 
20110118143804.000|20110118143807.000|TR0|then that is used as the financial aid 
20110118143807.000|20110118143810.000|TR0|offices around the country make up your 
20110118143810.000|20110118143812.000|TR0|student aid program, your package of 
20110118143812.000|20110118143815.000|TR0|student aid.
20110118143815.000|20110118143817.000|TR0|
20110118143817.000|20110118143820.000|TR0|Here is what you need to know.  I'm 
20110118143820.000|20110118143823.000|TR0|quoting, Zac Bissonnette, one of my 
20110118143823.000|20110118143825.000|TR0|sources who wrote a book called, "Debt for 
20110118143825.000|20110118143828.000|TR0|You."  And I want to just tell you, Kyra, 
20110118143828.000|20110118143830.000|TR0|we asked him to, you know, help us come up 
20110118143830.000|20110118143833.000|TR0|with the most important things to maximize 
20110118143833.000|20110118143836.000|TR0|your FAFSA.
20110118143836.000|20110118143838.000|TR0|
20110118143838.000|20110118143841.000|TR0|And he said, look, no one cares about you 
20110118143841.000|20110118143843.000|TR0|and your family's financial well-being 
20110118143843.000|20110118143846.000|TR0|except for you.  Colleges just want your 
20110118143846.000|20110118143849.000|TR0|money.  So you have to make sure you are 
20110118143849.000|20110118143851.000|TR0|very, very smart about this.  File early. 
20110118143851.000|20110118143854.000|TR0|File your FAFSA early.  Each university 
20110118143854.000|20110118143856.000|TR0|has a different date.  If you are going to 
20110118143856.000|20110118143859.000|TR0|apply for four or five different colleges, 
20110118143859.000|20110118143902.000|TR0|make sure you file the FAFSA for the first 
20110118143902.000|20110118143904.000|TR0|college -- the earliest college that wants 
20110118143904.000|20110118143907.000|TR0|it.  And there's a list of all of these on 
20110118143907.000|20110118143909.000|TR0|the government's FAFSA web site.
20110118143909.000|20110118143912.000|TR0|
20110118143912.000|20110118143915.000|TR0|File savings in the parents' name because 
20110118143915.000|20110118143917.000|TR0|this is incredibly important.  The way 
20110118143917.000|20110118143920.000|TR0|that the whole system works is you want to 
20110118143920.000|20110118143922.000|TR0|make sure that the savings is done in the 
20110118143922.000|20110118143925.000|TR0|parents' name rather than the students 
20110118143925.000|20110118143928.000|TR0|name because the FAFSA formula counts 
20110118143928.000|20110118143930.000|TR0|student savings more heavily than parents' 
20110118143930.000|20110118143933.000|TR0|savings.
20110118143933.000|20110118143935.000|TR0|
20110118143935.000|20110118143938.000|TR0|Also, under match.  What does that mean?  
20110118143938.000|20110118143941.000|TR0|Recognize that the financial aid office is 
20110118143941.000|20110118143943.000|TR0|going to give you a better package if you 
20110118143943.000|20110118143946.000|TR0|look overqualified.  So if you're going to 
20110118143946.000|20110118143948.000|TR0|go for these big reach schools, the top of 
20110118143948.000|20110118143951.000|TR0|the line you're probably going to get less 
20110118143951.000|20110118143954.000|TR0|of a package than if you shoot for 
20110118143954.000|20110118143956.000|TR0|something that's more like your "safety 
20110118143956.000|20110118143959.000|TR0|school." Think of it that way.
20110118143959.000|20110118144001.000|TR0|
20110118144001.000|20110118144004.000|TR0|Don't forget to apply to instate schools.  
20110118144004.000|20110118144007.000|TR0|This is a cost effective way for parents 
20110118144007.000|20110118144009.000|TR0|and students to pay for school.  Do not 
20110118144009.000|20110118144012.000|TR0|underestimate the instate schools.  You're 
20110118144012.000|20110118144014.000|TR0|going to graduate with a lot in loans.

20110118144524.000|20110118144527.000|TR0|MARK PRESTON, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL EDITOR: 
20110118144527.000|20110118144529.000|TR0| Hey good morning, Kyra. Yes, great news 
20110118144529.000|20110118144532.000|TR0|for President Obama.  Back in December his 
20110118144532.000|20110118144535.000|TR0|approval rating was at 48 percent which 
20110118144535.000|20110118144537.000|TR0|was a little higher than what we saw right 
20110118144537.000|20110118144540.000|TR0|before the elections but in the new CNN 
20110118144540.000|20110118144542.000|TR0|Opinion Research Corporation Poll out just 
20110118144542.000|20110118144545.000|TR0|this morning it shows his approval rating 
20110118144545.000|20110118144548.000|TR0|is at 53 percent.
20110118144548.000|20110118144550.000|TR0|
20110118144550.000|20110118144553.000|TR0|So it begs a question, why do see it 
20110118144553.000|20110118144555.000|TR0|rising?  Well, a couple of things.  First 
20110118144555.000|20110118144558.000|TR0|of all, he had a very successful lame duck 
20110118144558.000|20110118144601.000|TR0|session where, in fact, he got through the 
20110118144601.000|20110118144603.000|TR0|tax cut compromise.  By getting that 
20110118144603.000|20110118144606.000|TR0|through, he's probably able to pull over 
20110118144606.000|20110118144608.000|TR0|some independents that were on the fence 
20110118144608.000|20110118144611.000|TR0|of whether they thought he was doing a 
20110118144611.000|20110118144614.000|TR0|good job or not doing a good job.  In 
20110118144614.000|20110118144616.000|TR0|addition to that, Kyra, he also had that 
20110118144616.000|20110118144619.000|TR0|speech out in Tucson.  A lot of people
